item.title: T-1 Digital Telephone Lines
item.description:
Businesses with multiple phone lines might be leaving money on the table if they haven’t explored T-1 digital phone lines. Even businesses already using T1 service might be unaware of potential savings from newer options. Digital telephony emerged in the 1950s as phone companies sought efficient ways to handle large call volumes. Analog phone lines carried a single conversation per wire pair. While analog multiplexing (carrier telephony) allowed multiple calls on a single wire pair, it suffered from quality issues over long distances...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t-1-digital-telephone-lines/
